content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-325-07-A |Item_parent=Identification and management of risks associated with medicines and biomaterials, iatrogenic risk, medicinal errors (see items 4 and 5) |Item_parent_short=Identification and management of risks associated with medicines and biomaterials, iatrogenic risk, medication errors (see items 4 and 5) |Rank=A |Title=Know the characteristics of ADRs in the elderly |Description=None |Section=Definition |Contributors=Marie Briet |Order=7}} == Characteristics of ADRs in elderly subjects == * Increased frequency and severity (co-morbidities, multiple medications, age-related pharmacokinetic changes) * Varied symptomatology, atypical clinical presentations * Main drugs involved: cardiovascular drugs, psychotropic drugs, anticoagulants, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, etc.

question.title: What is a characteristic of ADRs in elderly subjects?

option_a.title: Increased frequency and severity due to age-related decline in organ function
option_a.description: This option is plausible but not entirely accurate

option_b.title: Varied symptomatology and atypical clinical presentations are more common in younger patients
option_b.description: This option is incorrect, but related to the topic

option_c.title: Increased frequency and severity due to co-morbidities and multiple medications
option_c.description: This option is accurate and reflects the correct answer

option_d.title: Main drugs involved are only cardiovascular drugs
option_d.description: This option is incorrect and oversimplifies the topic

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
